security: Revealing that Langelle was deliberately tough on CIA personnel who breached security, in order to build his cover as a non-CIA foreign service officer, could expose operational methods.
summary: Robert Genzman and Harold Leap interviewed Russell August Langelle in 1978, revealing details about his CIA career, including his work in SR9, his cover as a State Department Security Officer, and his involvement with P.S. Popov in Moscow.
summary_one_paragraph: In a May 4, 1978 interview at CIA Headquarters, Russell August Langelle disclosed to Robert Genzman and Harold Leap his CIA history, starting in September 1950 with SR9 of the Soviet Russia Division, and his staged resignation in 1955. Langelle explained his subsequent role as a State Department Security Officer, including his service in Vienna and Moscow, where he also acted as a senior CIA officer; he described his persona non grata declaration following his involvement with Soviet intelligence source P.S. Popov. Langelle recalled Lee Harvey Oswald's defection as a consular matter and specified the CIAâ€™s communication methods in Moscow.
title: Interview with Russell August Langelle
